ACT_NOW.author: lydiahallie
ACT_NOW.text_preview:
Claude Code now supports agent teams (in research preview)

Instead of a single agent working through a task sequentiall
ACT_NOW.reason: We actively delegate tasks to Claude Code but not as "agent teams" working in parallel. This feature could significantly change our execution workflows by allowing for parallel research, debugging, and building.
relevance: Delegation pattern: Claude.ai for planning, Claude Code for execution
Cross-project coordination with hall-of-fake sibling repo (potential to speed up video analysis and bug fixes)
ACT_NOW.proposed_action: Enable agent teams in settings.json and experiment with parallelizing tasks in the hall-of-fake sibling repo, specifically video analysis and bug fixes.

ACT_NOW.author: @PerceptualPeak
ACT_NOW.text_preview:
holy shit it fucking WORKS. 

SMART FORKING. My mind is genuinely blown. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND every Claude Code user imple
ACT_NOW.one_liner: Smart forking allows Claude Code users to leverage context from past sessions for efficient feature implementation using `/fork-detect` and a vectorized RAG database.
ACT_NOW.reason: This introduces a novel approach (smart forking) to leverage past Claude Code sessions for more efficient feature implementation, which we haven't explored. The use of embedding models and a vectorized RAG database to retrieve relevant context could significantly improve our workflow.
relevance: Directly addresses the problem of re-explaining context in new Claude Code sessions.
Aligns with our goal of improving efficiency in cross-instance communication and knowledge reuse.
ACT_NOW.proposed_action: Investigate the feasibility and potential benefits of implementing smart forking in our workflow. Start by exploring the shared git repo if available.

ACT_NOW.author: @anthonyriera
ACT_NOW.text_preview:
I tested every Claude Code skills and one DESTROYED the rest: "Planning with files".

This skill is literally a cheat co
ACT_NOW.one_liner: The "Planning with files" Claude Code skill significantly improves project planning and execution by having Claude persistently reference markdown files containing task plans.
ACT_NOW.reason: This introduces a specific Claude Code skill ('Planning with files') that seems to offer significant improvement in plan execution and reduced 'drift,' directly addressing a pain point in complex task management. Although we use file-based planning, the 'constant reminder' aspect achieved via this skill could be a game changer.
ACT_NOW.proposed_action: Immediately test the skill on a representative task to assess its effectiveness in reducing planning drift and improving execution accuracy. Compare its performance against our current file-based planning methods.
